title: Blame Conservatives and Their Austerity Measures for Why LGBTQ Healthcare Sucks in the UK
synopsis: Seven years of cuts have left the NHS on its knees, and we’re all suffering.

title: I Rewatched “Lip Service” and Now I Feel a Whole Lot Better About the Current State of Lesbian TV
synopsis: A lot has changed since Lip Service premiered. Is this show really only six years old? It feels like a lifetime ago.

title: “No Pride in Borders”: Queer Solidarity on the Streets of London
synopsis: Hundreds took to the streets of south-east London to support migrants at this weekend’s Peckham Pride.

title: “Pride” is the Uplifting Story of LGBTQ Activism and Solidarity We All Need Right Now
synopsis: The film Pride is as heart-warming as it is a rousing call for radical resistance and solidarity between oppressed groups.

title: Can Supergirl survive Trump?
synopsis: Television’s most optimistic flight of fantasy meets the year 2016.

title: New Digital Surveillance Laws Could Destroy The Online Queer Community
synopsis: Will the online expression of queer sexuality be regulated out of existence?

title: Bringing the Joy Back to Batman
synopsis: With much of the criticism of Batman v Superman taking aim at its dour tone, it’s the perfect time to take a look back on a brighter period in the Caped Crusader’s past.

title: Beyond Bechdel: A Brief History of Queer Comics
synopsis: We’re in the midst of a golden era for queer comics. However, you wouldn’t know it from looking at the big publishers, where LGBTQ+ folks remain as underrepresented as ever, both as creators and characters.

title: ‘Catwoman,’ ‘Elektra,’ and the Death of the Cinema Superheroine
synopsis: Cast your mind back, if you can, to a time before superhero films dominated the box office. This was the world Catwoman and Elektra premiered in.
